inventory.commentary: The FrameNet frame "Prohibiting" specifically states that it is a "state of affairs" and *not* an agent that results in the outlawing (and does not include this verb in "Deny_permission, which does allow for an agent); both VerbNet and PropBank identify an agent participant

sense.name: make illegal
sense.examples: Over the past four years, we have explicitly outlawed the ad hominem fallacy. The German Constitutional Court has outlawed preventive data screening. The U.S. is virtually alone among developed nations in outlawing marriage among first cousins. The EU has adopted a measure outlawing Holocaust denial.
